summary:
• Georgia's parliament has passed a 'foreign agent' law modeled after Russia's.
• The law requires non-governmental organizations receiving foreign funding to register as "foreign agents".
• This move is seen as a win for Russia, which has been pushing for similar laws across its borders.

• India's Prime Minister faces re-election challenge from opposition parties.
• State elections will play a crucial role in determining his chances of winning.
• National polls suggest a close race ahead of the election.

• Iran was responsible for at least 285 reported executions in 2023, according to Amnesty International.
• This represents a significant increase from previous years, with 106 reported executions in 2022 and 246 in 2019.
• The organization attributes the surge in executions to the country's strict drug laws, which can result in capital punishment for non-violent crimes such as drug possession.

• Israeli tanks have entered central Rafah.
• 21 people were killed in an airstrike in Rafah.
• Eyewitnesses described horrific scenes at the site of the attack.

• A long-lost Caravaggio painting of "extraordinary value" has been shown for the first time.
• The painting is highly valuable due to its rarity and historical significance.
• Its exhibition marks a significant cultural event in Italy.

• Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo is a Mexican politician who has been nominated by the National Regeneration Movement party as their candidate for President in the upcoming election.
• As a former engineer and economist, she brings a unique combination of technical expertise and political experience to the role.
• Her nomination marks a significant milestone in Mexican politics, as she would become the first female president if elected.

• Former Dutch spy chief Dick Schoof has been nominated as a prime minister candidate.
• He was chosen by the Netherlands' hard-right coalition.
• This decision marks a significant shift in the country's political landscape.

• Despite facing challenges, President Bola Tinubu has implemented policies aimed at boosting economic growth and security in Nigeria.
• The country continues to face corruption and infrastructure issues despite these efforts.
• Inflation remains a concern, with prices rising by over 15% in the past year.

• A landslide in Papua New Guinea has left many without homes.
• The disaster has affected around 7,900 people with limited hopes of finding more survivors.
• Emergency responders have been searching through the rubble to help those affected.

• The African National Congress (ANC) faces uncertainty regarding its majority status in the election.
• Political violence is on the rise ahead of the election, threatening stability.
• Elections will determine the fate of the ANC's dominance in South African politics.

• Jeremy Bowen reports from the site of a strike in Kharkiv.
• He also visits the jungle front line where Ukrainian forces fear being bombed if spotted.
• The conflict marks Ukraine's worst crisis since the start of the war.

• A new satellite will study cloud formation and its impact on climate change.
• The UK has grounded its entire WWII-era Spitfire fleet due to safety concerns after a fatal accident.
• UK conservatives propose introducing compulsory national service for young people, which may appeal less to Gen Z.

• The US believes Israel's recent operation in Rafah was not a major offensive.
• Heavy seas have rendered the US Gaza aid pier unusable.
• A suspect has been charged with injuring six people during a knife attack in the US.

• A row has erupted over the mysterious disappearance of a Zambian Member of Parliament.
• The missing politician's family is seeking answers from authorities about his whereabouts.
• An investigation is underway to determine what happened to him.
